title: No children nodes listed when changing data source for a data set in the Query Tab's data set editor page
OB: When attempting to change the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the Query Tab, no children nodes are listed. Steps to reproduce: 1. Create a new data set without a SQL statement. 2. In the data set editor page, go to the data source section. 3. Change the data source to a new one that has no database/table/column information. Actual result: The children nodes are not listed when changing the data source for the data set in the data set editor page of the Query Tab. Closing and reopening the data set editor does not resolve the issue.
SR: To reproduce the issue, follow these steps: 1. Create a new data set without a SQL statement. 2. Open the data set editor page in the Query Tab. 3. Go to the data source section in the editor. 4. Change the data source to a new one that has no database/table/column information. 5. Verify that no children nodes are listed. 6. Close the data set editor. 7. Reopen the data set editor and verify that the issue persists.
